meanings.definition: An officer in charge of financial accounts.
meanings.sent1: The comptroller carefully managed the company's financial records.
meanings.sent2: The comptroller reviewed the budget to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The comptroller joked that counting money all day was his idea of a good time.
meanings.sent4: She was the comptroller of her own destiny, balancing her budget like a pro.
meanings.sent5: The comptroller's job was like being a money detective, tracking every penny.

meanings.sent1: As the comptroller of the remote, he changed the channel effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The comptroller adjusted the temperature to make the room more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The comptroller playfully pretended to be in charge of the TV's volume.
meanings.sent4: She was the comptroller of the game, deciding the rules as she went along.
meanings.sent5: The comptroller of the music player, he selected the perfect song for the occasion.
